sub_topic: Finding the Hamiltonian cycle in a graph.
message_1:
Consider a graph G with 6 vertices A, B, C, D, E, and F. The edges are as follows:

A --> B
B --> C
C --> D
D --> E
E --> F
F --> A

Does the graph G contain a Hamiltonian cycle? If so, provide an example of one such cycle. If not, explain why.
message_2:
Yes, the graph G contains a Hamiltonian cycle. A Hamiltonian cycle is a closed loop on a graph where every node (vertex) is visited exactly once.

One example of a Hamiltonian cycle in this graph is:

A --> B --> C --> D --> E --> F --> A

This cycle visits all vertices exactly once and returns to the starting vertex A, forming a closed loop.
